intro: Oldenlandia senegalensis, commonly known as the African mosquito plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and typically grows as an annual herb or shrub. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are usually opposite and ovate, with a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
